sponsor.partnerMessage: Beth Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy weekend all! Here are some things going on over the next few days you might be interested in:

  • Two wheels: Bike Fest is this weekend! If you’re not already participating in the events, there will be so much to watch, so head out to Bentonville! 
  • Freedom Festival: The UofA and NWA Juneteenth Committee are hosting multiple events this weekend across NWA, culminating in Sunday’s Freedom Festival to celebrate emancipation.
  • Music: There will be a special Juneteenth Forest Concert Series concert tomorrow in the North Forest at Crystal Bridges.
  • Booths: Stop by and support your local farmers and makers this weekend at your local Farmers' Markets.
  • Mud pies: The whole family is invited to get messy at the 2nd annual Mess Fest on Saturday.
  • Break a leg: The Arkansas Shakespeare Theatre is in Fayetteville this weekend performing Much Ado About Nothing at the Global Campus Theater.
  • For a cause: Ride For a Healthier Tomorrow is going on right now, and it's a perfect excuse to be active this weekend.

As always, whatever you do, be safe and have fun! See you Monday!

posts.title: New Ice Cream Joint Coming To MLK Jr Blvd In Fayetteville
posts.content:
Just what we need for this hot weather: a new ice cream joint! 

  • The knick of time: It will actually have burgers, too, so even better. The new shop is bright pink and called Icescreams and will open in July, according to its website and social media.
  • Yum: The building, formerly occupied by Flying Burger & Seafood, is located at 4220 W. Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd. The Icescreams menu is not yet released, but you can expect burgers, tenders, wings, and desserts such as ice cream, milkshakes, and other goodness.

Click HERE, and your mouth might water a little bit.

posts.title: Tech Startup Offers Payments For Help Advancing Decentralized Networks
posts.content:
Mycelium Networks, a Fayetteville tech startup, is on a mission to accelerate the world’s adoption of decentralized networks, and you can get paid to help!

  • Ecosystem of innovation: In two short years, Mycelium Networks has united individuals and businesses to build the nation’s densest testbed for IoT devices, and it will continue deploying decentralized networks to advance the tech space in Northwest Arkansas. 
  • Help accelerate the future: If you’re not a “techie,” don’t worry. Mycelium is for everyone. Mycelium Networks vets the tech and provides the equipment for you to help keep the network online. Then you can sit back and receive monthly payments while helping promote innovation in our area! 

Join Mycelium today to be an early adopter of new tech in NWA, HERE.

posts.title: New Adventure Race Coming To NWA
posts.content:
There's going to be a new race on the Adventure Racing World Series (AWRS) calendar next year, and it will be in Northwest Arkansas.

  • Showcase: The ARWS is a multi-day, multi-discipline race that attracts the best racers from around the world and showcases the most beautiful parts of each participating country. The race in NWA will be called the Expedition Ozark race and will be yet another international stage for the Ozark region after the Cyclo-Cross Championships in Fayetteville.
  • On the way: The Expedition Ozark race will be a World Championship qualifier and one of only four races in the AWRS World Circuit held in North America. The NWA adventure will be April 3-8, 2023. 

Read the KNWA story HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Top tier: Accelerate your career with the Walton MBA program, ranked #11 best return on investment out of 600 MBA programs.*
  • Mingle: There is a UARK-Bentonville Collaborative Open House with music, food, and drinks on June 21st, 4-6p.*
  • Enrichment: Arkansas Arts Academy in Rogers is the ultimate K–12 choice for excellence in arts and education, with numerous summer events and programs.*
  • Mile-marker: There are new story columns in Springdale highlighting the history of the town.
  • Location: Arkansas has been named as one of the top 10 states people are moving to. 
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.
